title: Lincs cell line template schema
description: Lincs cell line template schema autogenerated by the CEDAR Template Editor

_ui.title: LINCS Cell Line
_ui.description: LINCS Cell Line Template working

_ui.title: CL_Name
_ui.description: The primary name for the cell line as chosen by LINCS

_ui.title: CL_LINCS_ID
_ui.description: Unique LINCS internal identifier

_ui.title: CL_Alternative_Name
_ui.description: Other relevant names

_ui.title: CL_Alternative_ID
_ui.description: Other relevant IDs for cell lines

_ui.title: CL_Organism
_ui.description: Organism of origin; a controlled vocabulary describing the organism from which the cell  line was derived (e.g. Homo sapiens, Mus musculus, etc.)

classes.label: Other
classes.source: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes (LOINC)

_ui.title: CL_Organ
_ui.description: Organ of origin; controlled terms describing the organ from which cell line is derived;   (e.g. lung, mammary gland etc.)

_ui.title: CL_Tissue
_ui.description: Tissue of origin; A controlled vocabulary describing the tissue from which the cell line  was derived

_ui.title: CL_Cell_Type
_ui.description: A controlled vocabulary describing  the cell type from which a cell line was derived; e.g.  epithelial like, fibroblast-like, lymphoblast like, hematopoetic, mesenchymal, neural, etc.  This provides information about cell morphology.  Also sometimes referred to as cell  morphology.

_ui.title: CL_Cell_Type_Detail
_ui.description: Additional description of cell type (histology) that is not available in CL, but may be  known from other sources like ATCC

_ui.title: CL_Donor_Sex
_ui.description: Describes sex of the organism from which the cell was obtained

_ui.title: CL_Donor_Age
_ui.description: The age of the donor

_ui.title: CL_Donor_Ethnicity
_ui.description: For human cells, the ethnicity of the donor

_ui.title: CL_Donor_Health_Status
_ui.description: Controlled vocabulary describing the health status of the donor

_ui.title: CL_Disease
_ui.description: If the cell line came from a particular diseased tissue, the disease should be noted in  terms of a controlled vocabulary (e.g. breast cancer, colon cancer, not diseased, etc.)

_ui.title: CL_Disease_Detail
_ui.description: Additional description of a disease related to the cell line that may not be available in the  disease ontology above

_ui.title: CL_Known_Mutations
_ui.description: Mutations inherent (from the donor) in the cell line, captured explicitly; e.g. if reference is  not available

_ui.title: CL_Mutation_Citations
_ui.description: Mutations inherent in certain cell lines; from a reference

_ui.title: CL_Molecular_Features
_ui.description: Relevant molecular and morphological features of the Cell Line

_ui.title: CL_Genetic_Modification
_ui.description: Stable transfection, viral transduction or any other genetic modifications (de novo mutations, translocations) that were acquired. If yes, the modifications (e.g. expressing GFP-tagged protein) should be described and appropriate references provided. This requires a number of fields including the parental cell line

_ui.title: CL_Growth_Properties
_ui.description: A controlled vocabulary describing the growth properties of the cell line (e.g. adherent, suspension)

_ui.title: CL_Recommended_Culture_Conditions
_ui.description: A description of the standard tissue culture conditions (media, supplements, culture dish treatment) used to maintain the cell line. Description of culture dish treatment conditions would include information about coating of culture dish with fibronectin, collagen, etc, prior to cell plating. If special culture vessels are required to grow the cells, these should also be mentioned and details provided.

_ui.title: CL_Related_Projects
_ui.description: Other projects in which the cell line has been studied / used; A controlled vocabulary describing other large scale projects in which the cell line has been used (e.g. ENCODE, TCGA, ICBP, Epigenomics, etc.)

_ui.title: CL_Verification_Reference_Profile
_ui.description: Expected STR (reference) profile of the cell line based on provider information, if available

_ui.title: CL_Relevant_Citations
_ui.description: List of references (with PMIDs) of relevance to cell line derivation, etc.

_ui.title: CL_Reference_Source
_ui.description: Established repository for the cell line, or the name of the investigator who provided the cell line if the cell line is not available via an established repository

_ui.title: CL_Reference_Source_ID
_ui.description: Identifier from the reference source

_ui.title: CL_Center_Name
_ui.description: Name of the LINCS Center that is using the Cell Line

_ui.title: CL_Center_Specific_ID
_ui.description: LINCS center-specific cell line ID; batch specific ID

_ui.title: CL_Provider_Name
_ui.description: Name of vendor or lab (provider) that supplied the cell line

_ui.title: CL_Provider_Catalog_ID
_ui.description: ID or catalogue number or name assigned to the cell line by the vendor or provider

_ui.title: CL_Provider_Batch_ID
_ui.description: Vendor/Provider Batch ID number; Batch or lot number assigned to the cell line by the vendor or provider

_ui.title: CL_Quality_Verification
_ui.description: Information pertaining to experimental verification of the cell line identity; batch-specific ID; STR profiling

_ui.title: CL_Transient_Modification
_ui.description: Transient transfection or viral transduction

_ui.title: CL_Cell_Markers
_ui.description: A controlled vocabulary describing the markers used to isolate / identify the cell type

_ui.title: CL_Passage_Number
_ui.description: The number of times, if any that the cells have been re-plated and allowed to grow back to confluency or to some maximum density if using suspension cultures

_ui.title: CL_Gonosome_Code
_ui.description: List of the sex chomosomes (gonosome) of the sample e.g. XX, XY, XXY

_ui.title: CL_Disease_Site_Onset
_ui.description: Site of disease onset in primary cell donor

_ui.title: CL_Disease_Age_Onset
_ui.description: Age of disease onset in primary cell donor (in years)

_ui.title: CL_Donor_Age_Death
_ui.description: Age of death of primary cell donor (in years)

_ui.title: CL_Donor_Disease_Duration
_ui.description: Disease duration in cell donor; Age of Sample Acquisition - Age of Onset. (in years)
